website_summaries.verdict: Best used as a portable, temporary option, or for use at home. Under such circumstances, it is a fine choice.
pros: Handles adjust and the wheels roll easy
Unit is ideal as a portable option for those in need of mobile support
cons: Not comfortable for long periods of use

customer_reviews.title: Worked so well I bought another
customer_reviews.text: I bought this walker for my grandfather. Out of the box it only took 5 minutes to complete. All that was needed to build was to attach the handles. Wheels, frame and brakes are already built. Strong amd sturdy. Big enough for a man approximately 6'1" when the handles are extended. Anyone taller may need to adjust it by drilling an additional hole in the handle bars but would be fairly easy. As is it was perfect for our needs. Liked it so much that we decided to buy a second walker, one for upstairs and another downstairs.
customer_reviews.author: Jason C

customer_reviews.title: Product Unsafe due to brakes not working
customer_reviews.text: I'm extremely disappointed. The brakes are not working anymore. I did not expect that they,would be out within 6-8 months of my purchase. Unfortunately, I cannot afford a new one and remain feeling unsafe on my walker as it rolls when I sit down, and even worse, when I go to stand. Please, can you help me with a new one?
customer_reviews.author: Katherine McClain

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. Not much assembly, so it is quick and easy, only takes a few minutes. Rolls very smoothly and the brakes are good. It has storage under the seat for purse. The padded backrest is nice and thick. The seat could use a little more padding, since I don't have any myself. What would give it a perfect 5 stars is a little locking mechanism for taking it in and out of the car because it tends to open up a little which makes it difficult and I'm afraid of hurting myself because I have a lot of health problems.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara P.

customer_reviews.title: I bought this walker a few months ago for an ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this walker a few months ago for an elderly friend, and she likes it very much. HOWEVER, one of the brake cables recently came out of the housing, and Drive Medical informed me that the part was not covered under their lifetime warranty. They did offer to send me a replacement part for more than half of the cost of a new walker. I'm upset about this, and feel that they should have backed up their equipment with more support. I will not buy another walker from Drive because of this.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Leichtman

customer_reviews.title: Very unstable to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 65 yr old Mom who had knee replacement to use instead of hospital issued kind. She tried it for a day a couldn’t keep control of it rolling so fast in front of her. Even her physical therapists said they usually don’t comment or recommend one way or the other, but these kinds of walkers are the worst walkers to use as far as balance and control. We’re not sending it back but it will be sitting in the garage in storage. :(
customer_reviews.author: MDJeepGirl

customer_reviews.title: Product quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Drive walker through Amazon 1-31-19. I took delivery of it the first week of February. This walker was bought for my 87 year old mother. It’s less than 6 months old and the brakes went out. My mother only weighs 128 lbs. So, it’s not an issue of size. It’s an issue of poor quality. I feel as though there should be something done on your part to make this right for her. She can barely get along and she depends on this walker. Drive refused to do anything about it. They say warranty was good for only 60 days.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Briscoe

customer_reviews.title: The brake cables are very poor. Within 2 month we had to have one ...
customer_reviews.text: The brake cables are very poor. Within 2 month we had to have one of them replaced at a cost of $85 for parts and labor. You cannot replace just the cable, you have to replace the whole hand grip and cable. Guess what the cable broke again. I think I need to just toss the walker and get a new one of a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Custohmer

customer_reviews.title: Great transitional tool, or for everyday use
customer_reviews.text: For a few bucks more, stop dragging that "walker" around. As a healing tool, or if you are steady enough, this makes a great transitional tool for rehab. Where were these "Rollators" several years ago when I had my knees replaced? Time and Medicine march forward. Just wish it folded a little flatter, but the light weight makes it easier to throw it in and out of the car, put it in a closet, etc.
customer_reviews.author: johnfcon

customer_reviews.title: Awkward and broke quickly
customer_reviews.text: I just had a hip replacement a week ago and am not pleased with this walker. The left break lock quit working, making it unstable for transferingmysel to a chair. The storage compartment is frayed, because it was poorly sewn. It only held my purse a few times. It is very difficult to put into the car. The handles must be unscrewed and the bolts stored in my purse. I have to use bungee cords to hold things together enough to get it into the trunk. This is time consuming and awkward. It does roll easily and has a seat if you need a rest
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight enough for a weak elderly person to handle
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this walker for my 99-yr-old mother because she cannot handle the heavier steel walkers. This one works the same way as the heavy-duty ones but is easier for her to get into and out of her car when she goes out. It was a little bit hard for her to fold at first, but a neighbor showed her how to do it and then all was ok.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Ilten

customer_reviews.title: So far this Rolater is working good, easy manuvered and made for what it’s intended ...
customer_reviews.text: So far this Rolater is working good, easy to manuvere and made for what it’s intended for. As many have said, this unit need a very simple strap to insure it stays folded when placing it in a car and taking it out! I use a bungi cord made for tying down things. I’ll see how this works after a few months. I weigh 222 lbs and sitting on it when still, works fine. I’m glad I got this one instead of the larger ones. Fits through my condo doors which are normal widths! Be aware of door sizes and which rolater you buy! This one is just right!
customer_reviews.author: Techi Guy

customer_reviews.title: This product is missing parts
customer_reviews.text: We like this walker, but it is missing two bolts and two knobs for the handle height adjustment. We would like to keep it if you could get us the parts, but if you can't we'll send it back and start over. If we can get the parts we'll be glad to give it five stars. Thank you very much Patricia Lamb
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DEFECTIVE EQUIPMENT
customer_reviews.text: Just unpacked my walker 05/30/20 with NO Height Adjustable knobs included, so I spent an additional $17 for replacements. But Low and Behold still can't use the walker because the Orthodic Hand Grips are GLUED BACKWARDS!!! The Loop Lock SAFETY System are also on BACKWARDS!!! The right hand grip is on the LEFT side, and the Right handle grip is on the left side. AMAZON says I can't return the item although I purchased the Rollator on 05/24/20, because they think this disabled veteran has money that grows on trees. The company has limited staff, so I can't get any assistance from them.
customer_reviews.author: TeeTee

customer_reviews.title: Amazon or Drive Medical needs to provide missing and broken part replacement
customer_reviews.text: Mine was obviously a return, and the back support was missing. I wish someone would help me obtain the back support, any color. Most of the one star reviews are the result of missing or broken parts. Amazon or Drive Medical should provide replacements for missing or broken parts.
customer_reviews.author: Epicurus

customer_reviews.title: Good walker, but...
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be sturdy. My mother is 5'1" and 200 lbs. She can lock the brakes and sit on seat, which is 18 inches spaces between the handlebars...just enough for her. It was very easy to put together, as you only have to slide the handlebars into the holes on both sides, and adjust to user height. The only negative I found, is that the wheels are cheap plastic, so when using the walker going down a ramp at restaurant, the wheels just slide on floor when you apply brakes. It was a very dangerous situation, if I were not there holding the walker to slow it down, she would have fell.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonXpert

customer_reviews.title: Drive Medical Aluminum Rollator Walker Fold Up and Removable Back Support
customer_reviews.text: I really like this rollator walker. It's light weight and easy to transport when you go out. It's sturdy and well made. I would recommend this walker to anyone who needs a little extra help when walking. I love the seat also. When I take walks, it's nice to be able to stop, lock the wheels and sit for a few minutes. I know you will like it too.
customer_reviews.author: C. Travers

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and sturdy...Not so easy to fold
customer_reviews.text: I love that this walker has a seat that is comfortable and a backrest for when you need to stop and rest. The compartment under the seat holds a lot. It is very sturdy and helps me to stand up straighter and walk better. I even took it to Monticello. Hard to push on top of pebbles/rocks but easy on grass and dirt pathways. I recommend getting this if you need extra help walking especially if you are walking long distances and may need to rest.
customer_reviews.author: S. Duke

customer_reviews.title: the wheels turn
customer_reviews.text: I brought this walker for my sister because she likes it, but this is the 3rd time I purchased this item and I find after 3 or 4 months the left back wheel stops turning. If this happens again with this purchase I will write a very bad review on this walker to make all the people see how this is a problem and the Drive Company is not fixing this problem. So far I have spend almost $300 on this product and I refuse to spend another dollar.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Meyers

customer_reviews.title: Walks.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a client. She never stops a d oh my gosh doesn't her body just know it. She seems very happy with the walker. The only information I would like to add is that she picked this one because of the description of a padded seat. Well, from my experience, this seat is no more padded than any other walker. In fact I had another client with a walker that was padded...this was not the one. My client got herself a little cushion for this walker, and she is happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jane E. Hallett

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: I really like this walker as it seems to be well-made and will make it very easy to take with me in the car. However, it was missing the 2 tightening screws that hold the arms in place. Amazon was unable to provide the two missing parts. I'm going to have to try and find something at the hardware store as the walker cannot be used without them. I would have given it 5 stars if the parts were included or the manufacturer would send them to me.
customer_reviews.author: Shaelyn

customer_reviews.title: A great lower-cost option!
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased! Not too heavy to manuever down or up a staircase if needed. Excellent directional control compared to old fashioned walkers - like the difference between luggage on wheels versus luggage on spinners.. Handy to have a seat when other available seating isn't workable for your situation, and I find the seat to be a suitable enough size. I love the security of the braking system, and the height adjustability. I also find the under the seat storage extremely handy. I would definitely buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: P. Perkins

customer_reviews.title: I am 5' 2" and am purchasing a walker to ...
customer_reviews.text: I am 5' 2" and am purchasing a walker to help me after a major surgery. This walker is very light. The handles shake a little from side-to-side so this was a deal breaker for me in case I am trying to stabilize myself. The walker folds up flat and is large folded.
customer_reviews.author: AY

customer_reviews.title: My in-laws are more than satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: My mother in-law is pleased with this walker. I would like to see a way that it can lock when folded so that it doesn't open when putting it in the car. I may be able to figure out a way to hold it that will make it easier. My father in-law already had the same walker and they wanted exactly the same. They say many residents of the senior living center have this one. They first had a different brand of walker of similar cost and think that the ease of navigation is better with the Drive brand.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Good walker but not easy to transport
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mother and it is a bit of a disappointment. She has a light foldable walker with skis. She also has a really nice Drive Euro style walker but it is too heavy for to collapse and out in the car. This is a nice walker but it is heavier than I expected and it is not easy to collapse and put in a car so she can not use it alone. Fyi, when you collapse it, it does not lock in place so it wants to unfold.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my mother shortly after she started needing a walker. Works so much better for her than the less expensive fold up style walker. She is a somewhat large woman and it is wide and sturdy enough for her to sit on and is comfortable enough for sitting for short periods. The storage area is nice to have; she no longer has to keep up with a purse. It rolls easily. The handles are adjustable. This walker has been in daily use for about 18 months and is still working well and without problems.
customer_reviews.author: WL

customer_reviews.title: light weight, great price!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together, I have read a lot of reviews about being damage on receiving,( broken wheels, frame broke ), this had no damage at all, But I can under stand why some are broken when received. the box they come in, the cardboard is so thin it would not take much of a fall to break them if dropped. So if the box is damaged send it back or check it out good first. I got it for my Wife She loves it works good, easy to but on back seat of truck or suv . so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Handy Andy

customer_reviews.title: Faulty product.
customer_reviews.text: Wheel came off after two weeks of use. Bought it brand new to take on my cruise. My nephew had to figure out a way to keep it on. He used a Visine bottle top and toenail clippers to make a temp repair until I could get back home to make something more permanent. Nearly ruined my vacation. It is light weight and folds easily.
customer_reviews.author: MARY BURKE

customer_reviews.title: This is the real deal
customer_reviews.text: This is the one they use at the rehab facilities near me. Very reliable, solid, easy to use. Pretty much the last word in rolling walkers. Lots of accessories available too.
customer_reviews.author: T. R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: got this one and it has been a very good choice for me
customer_reviews.text: Never wanted one of these but found it necessary.... got this one and it has been a very good choice for me. It's light weight, the seat is comfortable with the added comfort of the back rest. The seat has an area to store water bottles and etc very useful. Rolls so easy and brakes work great. Easy to steer I'm 6' and is very sturdy even with handles fully extended. Oh did I say that it actually took 90 seconds to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: visitor#51

customer_reviews.title: Allows me to walk again!
customer_reviews.text: I can walk again!!! I absolutely adore this! The only issue is that it does not stay closed for air travel, but I purchased Nite Ize adjustable bungees for that purpose and it works beautifully. If you do that, buy the smallest size. Nite Ize NCJSB-M1-R8 CamJam Micro Bungee, Black, 1-Pack
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: It is so useful and the ease of use helped me exercise more till I was strong again.
customer_reviews.text: What a useful and easy to use item. After my hip replacement the old walker was just not that easy to get around with. Having wheels this one I am sure helped speed my recovery. It moves so easy that I was able to develop a stride while walking which in turn helped me heal faster. I am recovered now but still use it to carry heavier objects and the laundry. I also use it to bring in the groceries from the car.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great rollator walker. I am please with the quality of the drive products. Was easy to assemble. I have ordered and used different rollator type walkers, since I am a Therapist and train people to use them, and I prefer the type of handle adjustment on this walker with the holes so that you get equal handle height. I also prefer the bag style vs basket style holder so that people don’t have small items they are carrying fall through the holes in the basket. It also has the rounded back which is more comfortable when sitting on the seat.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa F

customer_reviews.title: Product recommended for sure!
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'6 and weigh 237 lbs and it's wide enough and stable to hold me. I have MS it helps me get around when I'm not 100%. There's a compartment under the seat to place some med to small items. The depth is so good size. The handles have brakes that you squeeze while walking like a bike handle has also when your seating you can push down and it'll lock. The seat is hard plastic not very comfortable. I added a pillow seat. Easy to assemble when arriving, easy to fold (only folds in half) when traveling. You can adjust the height of the handle bars.
customer_reviews.author: Maribel

customer_reviews.title: Work ok, could be better
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my father. I wanted to wait a while before writing the review. Unfortunately, my father didn't have much chance to use it before he passed away so here goes the review. The first shipment arrived with broken clips at the bottom of the seat. The replaced items is ok. easy to put together, easy to fold. Support my father well when he walk. He did express he didn't feel sturdy when sitting down.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Keep rolling
customer_reviews.text: My husband just had a hip replacement and where we live is not conducive to the standard 2 wheeled walker, so I thought this would be better. It is and we're very happy with it. It was very easy to put together and it was so much cheaper than the one in Walgreens and even almost $20 less than the one at Walmart. Since he's going to have other surgeries in the future that will require this, I consider it a really good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne Livingston-Spencer

customer_reviews.title: several months in it's still a positive review
customer_reviews.text: got this for my FIL and he has used this to the exclusion of his regular walker. brakes work good, and he loves the cubby under the seat for "stuff" I would not recommend a rollator for someone who is super dependent on a walker for stability as this kind will still slide over a slick surface. But if you need it for some general safety when walking, then it's great. FYI: don't get on the moving sidewalk with it...just ask my hard headed FIL, lol. Some people just don't know any better, bless their hearts. : ) p.s. he was ok, just his pride wounded : )
customer_reviews.author: Amy Grace

customer_reviews.title: Mother Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this walker for my elderly mother. She says it has given her a greater feeling of stability as she walks. She find that it is easy to maneuver while at the same time giving her the security needed. She practically likes the ability to carry her book, sawing, and other things with her on the basket of the walker. She would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: L Boettcher

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit
customer_reviews.text: Seat is too high for Mom who is 4'9" and 107 lbs. Seat height is not adjustable. Seat is hard, textured vinyl so she slipped off too easily. It does not fold easily. I struggled with the seat and safety bar (movable) whenever I tried to fold for transport via car. This order is partly my fault. Another family member ordered a junior-sized rolling walker. We shall see. This one sits on the side for now.
customer_reviews.author: Josie H.

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my grandmother who is starting to have mobility issues. She has the old fashioned tennis ball walker but it was getting harder to lift it and she was still stumbling. She can speed along with this one! She even uses the seat to rest when she needs to. It folds up easy and fits right into the trunk. Best money I've spent seeing how happy it has made her.
customer_reviews.author: NC

customer_reviews.title: Quality issues!
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived in a damaged box. The rollator was damaged, bent brake. It is cheaply made as compared to the same vendor's steel version which is sturdy and arrived on good condition. Spend the extra few dollars and purchase the steel one!
customer_reviews.author: christine myles

customer_reviews.title: Great overall walker...no complaints!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this walker for my mom...she loves everything about it. Using the walker has improved her balance. She was using a cane before walker and was dragging her one foot. Now the dragging foot is less. She has used the seat multiple times when she felt worn out and needed to rest before going back to her room. Excellent light weight walker.
customer_reviews.author: JMT

customer_reviews.title: I would highly recommend this to a friend!!!!
customer_reviews.text: If you use your walker outside or in public places, the wheels are going to get dirty, which is going to make your floors/carpets dirty when you bring it home. My solution is to have two walkers. This is the walker I take in the car because it is so lightweight and the same strap you pull on to close the walker is located at the balance point, which makes it easy to control the walker with one hand when putting it in the car. So far, the 6" wheels are big enough to get over the bumps without sticking.
customer_reviews.author: Terry H.

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: These are not at all durable. The brakes begin to fail quickly. My PT has had to adjust it every second or third time I use it. This brand does make better (and more expensive) rollators. Unless you only expect to use this for a short time, you'd be better off buying a more expensive model.
customer_reviews.author: LK

customer_reviews.title: Great Value and a Great Looking Unit
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for my elderly mother-in-law following a fall. She was reluctant to get a walker so we needed one that she would not feel self-conscious while using. She was very impressed by the look and feel and ease of use, and did use the walker when needed. This unit looks upscale and has many features that adds great value. The seat, brakes and stowing are all easy to do. The price is amazing for such a good looking unit.
customer_reviews.author: L. A. Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and very portable.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to fold, easy to maneuver. Had to talk my husband into using it (he was using a cane but was becoming so unsteady). Now he thanks me for getting this, gets around better, uses the seat a lot. Very easy to fold and very lightweight so no problem putting into trunk of car to go wherever. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: calli8

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to fold and unfold
customer_reviews.text: Walker does what you want it to. Easy to use with the exception of folding and unfolding for transport in the car. I wish there were handles or similar device to facilitate easy folding and unfolding. Also, a little heavy and bulky when lifting into the car. A person who needs a walker would find it very difficult, near impossible, to be able to use it unassisted if they had to fold it and lift it it into a car. Otherwise, very happy with walker's function.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Drive rollator walker
customer_reviews.text: We like it, but the brake works on one side and does not on the other side. Several people have looked at the directions I printed from the website, but we cannot get the brake to work. Would give it a 5 except for the brakes. Thinking about ditching it and buying from a medical supply company here in town so we would have someone to work on it.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Phillips

customer_reviews.title: happy to have a new safe Walker
customer_reviews.text: Comes preassembled. Very smooth to roll. Brakes hold cart firmly in place. I had a older Walker and the brakes were not holding and wheels started to squeek, it wasn't worth trying to repair, happy to have a new safe Walker.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline

customer_reviews.title: Good quality at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Good item for a good price for someone who is recovering from spine surgery. It runs smoothly but not too freely where you feel it is in control instead of you. I got a customer return with some scratches on it, but for the price that was no big deal. The price was right and it will get stretched anyway and it does not effect the way it works. This is a high quality name brand and a good investment to keep you on your feet when you are having trouble walking.
customer_reviews.author: Slickwilly

customer_reviews.title: Walking Without Fear!
customer_reviews.text: Being visually impaired, I need my Drive Rollator for both balance and to help me "see" unevenness of the ground ahead. Also, it makes it possible for me to go out to tend my raised vegetable garden beds. The light weight has made it possible to move easily. For me, there's nothing to dislike about this. Although some have said it's flimsy, I don't find it so.
customer_reviews.author: J. S. Green

customer_reviews.title: Very good walker - Wish I'd Bought It Sooner
customer_reviews.text: I was really impressed with this walker. I was tempted to buy a cheaper one but I'm so glad I bought this one. My mother was so excited when she saw it and she loves it. It required little to no set-up and is perfect for vacations. We didn't have to bring my mom's wheelchair, which weighs a ton. This was a life-saver. I love the black color and the storage compartment. I was very impressed with this walker and so was my mom. I just hope it lasts a couple years.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly Chan

customer_reviews.title: Decent, lightweight rollator
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a second rollator that I could keep in my car and use while away from the house. I wanted a lighter unit that was easier to load and unload from the car. It meets that objective, but is not as safe in the process. The brakes and wheels are flimsy. The frame is downsized. That being said, this rollator is decent value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Steven L. Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Great little rollator, right up to when it isn't
customer_reviews.text: The rollator was light, easy to use, great for travel...right up until one of the brake cables snapped while I was out using it. Barely nine months old. Had this happened while I was going down an incline that could easily have led to a fall.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great deal on a very nice walker
customer_reviews.text: Well, if you really need a walker, this is a great one. Rolls easily, brakes well, no more tennis balls or skids on the bottom. As attractive as a walker can be. A tremendously good price if purchased as an Amazon Prime member. You get the underseat bag, and the color is a dignified black, not red or blue. Thanks Prime, for a great product and an even better price!
customer_reviews.author: MAinMI

customer_reviews.title: I knee and hip problems as well as poor balance. I have been using it for about ...
customer_reviews.text: I knee and hip problems as well as poor balance. I have been using it for about a month now. Excellent quality and very helpful to have it. This rollator walker does really help me to maintain my balance and to also be able to walk without fear of tripping or falling down. I can walk much better and with confidence. No complaints whatsoever!.
customer_reviews.author: A  Puig

customer_reviews.title: ... daughter's mom mother and it assemble together well and easily collapse so that it can fit in the trunk ...
customer_reviews.text: This drive medical walker was purchased for my daughter's mom mother and it assemble together well and easily collapse so that it can fit in the trunk of your car flawlessly. This item is highly recommended for anyone that have trouble getting around and have mobility issues. It's construction is of superior quality and her mom absolutely love this device now that she's able to get around again. I highly recommend the purchasing of this item.
customer_reviews.author: JFamily

customer_reviews.title: NO SHAME GET YOURSELF FREEDOM OF MOBILITY ❣️❣️❣️
customer_reviews.text: I thank God for this product.... I have recommended sooo many people to amazon for this!!! They saw firsthand how much easier my life is because of this product!!! I should be getting a bonus for all my referrals!!! And very satisfied customers indeed!!!💋💯❣️
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for my 89-year-old mother, whose physical therapist recommended a walker instead of the cane she'd been using. More to help her achieve an even gait than for heavy physical support. The walker is very sturdily made and comparable to ones costing twice as much as at places like Walgreens. I haven't tried to fold it up yet since it's primarily for use at her assisted-living complex, so I can't rate that. All in all very happy with the purchase and she finds it easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Pintar

customer_reviews.title: Not safe since brakes are not good
customer_reviews.text: Big con: brakes do not last which renders the product virtually useless. I had them adjusted and very quickly they were failing again. Pro: Fits through most doorways easily, nice to have a pouch for storing items This item was a disappointment. I would not order again.
customer_reviews.author: paula

customer_reviews.title: Nice Walker
customer_reviews.text: Was exactly what my mom needed. I was easy to assemble and adjust for her. The seat height is ideal (she is 5 ft 2 in tall) and it is lighter weight than her old walker, I is also easier to fold up,
customer_reviews.author: Lisa A. Hausner

customer_reviews.title: Arrived as scheduled easy to assemble and liked that it was light weighted ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived as scheduled easy to assemble and liked that it was light weighted easy to put in the car trunk or behind the seat in car liked the smaller wheels and bag underneath hold a lot but not easy to fold and stay til loaded in the car& seat flops down .But I needed this Thanks for quick delivery right to front door .
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandmother (5'10 and 180lbs). She loved it! She was able to collapse it herself and load it into her van. She passed away and I gave this to my friends 11 year old daughter with mobility issues. She now LOVES it. The rails adjust for different heights. It folds easily. The storage under the seat is nice. It also was no trouble to assemble. All in all a good purchase to help people be mobile💓
customer_reviews.author: Skeletori

customer_reviews.title: GreAt
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my grandma it is easy to assemble and it is very sturdy. Has a little hidden pouch and the seat makes it easy for her to sit when she is tired. She can lock the wheels when she doesn’t want it to move. It folds easily but if you have a small car or trunk it’s difficult to fit it in especially if you have other things in the trunk of car.
customer_reviews.author: kara

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed with the quality.
customer_reviews.text: After reading many reviews, I decided to purchase this for my mother. She has had multiple problems with it in the two years she has been using it. The brakes would hang up intermittently. Now all of the wheel bearings have failed. The cost of replacing the wheels is more than the cost of a new walker. I will not be purchasing a Drive walker again.
customer_reviews.author: Bonni

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: After knee surgery I needed a walker that rolled. I wanted one with a seat so that I could sit if I had to wait in a line. Beneath the seat is a nice storage spot. I was able also to push my meal on the seat to get to my chair since I needed both hands for either crutches or the walker. Assembly was a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ballard

customer_reviews.title: The seat surface is my concern now!! The unit itself is great ! It's  my 2nd purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This is the2nd purchase of this item. I love this rotator But im not happy with the seat covering on this years model. It's plain material & shows every spot & they can't be cleaned or wiped off. What would you recommend on cleaning this surface?? I can't send a photo as the spots don't show up on camera. Please advise !!
customer_reviews.author: Beve

customer_reviews.title: lightweight and ease of use
customer_reviews.text: Super light weight, narrower than other walkers - this allows egress through a 32 inch doorway! This thing is a little speed demon, make sure the user knows how the breaks function or, they could lose control as the unit itself is super easy to push forward. The combo seat/stuff holder is convenient too.
customer_reviews.author: jess

customer_reviews.title: Look around the prices are all over the place for these things
customer_reviews.text: The wheels were a little on the cheap side and one of the spokes was broken we returned it I ended up getting it somewhere else a better one for less
customer_reviews.author: C. Ortega

customer_reviews.title: Too tall for my mom
customer_reviews.text: I thought it might be adjustable, but it was not. It was my fault for not checking thoroughly. My mom is 4'9" so it is much too tall for her. Her legs dangle like a child's when she sits on the seat. But, for the person of the right height this would be a good buy. The walker is actually of good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Teacher's Pet

customer_reviews.title: This unit is very stable and can safely be moved by someone sitting in it
customer_reviews.text: The unit is very light and can easily be placed in or removed from a car by a small person. It is also very stable, especially with the brakes locked. A large person can even safely push himself around while sitting in it. The wheels are a little small when encountering obstacles, and should probably be 8" instead of 6". It would be even more useful if it could pass through a narrow 24" bathroom door, which it cannot because of the 26" width.
customer_reviews.author: George W. Burker

customer_reviews.title: Screws were missing!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time we ordered the walker as it did its job fine. However, when my husband tried to assemble it, he realized 2 screws were missing! We will need to take the screws from the old walker and move to the new one. Not pleased!
customer_reviews.author: MDR

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight walker
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my elderly mother who is 5' 2" and weighs 150 lb. It was very simple to put together (less than 5 min). It is lightweight and easily maneuvered. It quickly collapses for placement in a truck or storage. The locking mechanism makes it safe for individuals to sit on the seat. The seat offers a small amount of storage beneath. It seems very sturdy; however, it is a lightweight model and I would not recommend this for a heavier person. (225+ lbs).
customer_reviews.author: SJP

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, maneuverable and stable
customer_reviews.text: The rollater was easy to put together (my 12 year old grandson did it), and I like that it’s lightweight and maneuverable and stable. Folding it up was not intuitive, but watching a you tube video showed that it was easy to do. As others suggested, I bought a bungee cord to keep it folded. The price was reasonable. Happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lenore M. Kulek

customer_reviews.title: Good if not broken
customer_reviews.text: Would have been great but arrived broken. The lid to the chair was cracked. Was also too wide for easy maneuvering. Checked measurements but corners were too tight. If you have more space and it arrives unbroken it would be a great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: A helpful “partner”
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this item. It is well planned, made with quality materials and easily assembled. I like the built-in seat for taking a quick rest on long walks. When dining out, it folds up so it’s out of the way. And the under-the-seat compartment comes in very handy for storing little packages instead of using space and energy hand-carrying things.
customer_reviews.author: Claudine Bouchard

customer_reviews.title: Great for function and durability
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy and convenient to assemble. I bought this for my father who uses it for walking and taking breaks when using his prosthetic. It's stable and glides well with all four wheels rotating. Lifting the seat can make it kind of awkward to fold, it's not the lightest, and the brakes are not the tightest but we chose this for function and durability.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: ... mom has owned two of these and they work great while they last
customer_reviews.text: My mom has owned two of these and they work great while they last. But we have noticed that the construction of the wheels seems to be poor. My mom is 84 and not rough with these, but they only last about 6 months before the wheels break. Of course, I guess they are not too much money, but I seem to have to buy 2 a year.
customer_reviews.author: Rochelle Burn

customer_reviews.title: Great light weight walker with seat and pouch
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this walker. I love the green color. I wanted one with the seat to sit and rest if needed. I also wanted one with the pouch for throwing in my purse and keys and anything else I might need. It has worked out perfect. It is light weight so I can throw it in the back of my SUV. I was folding it but found that I can leave it open and it will fit which saves time. I would recommend to anyone looking for a walker that has more than just a frame and wheels..
customer_reviews.author: Maryann Kyer

customer_reviews.title: possible safety concerns
customer_reviews.text: Would give this 5 stars, but for safety concerns ... First, the brakes on the walker we received for our relative do not lock well. Second, there are wires that stick out so far (near the handles) that they het caught on things.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good price for the product!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 89 year old father, who is becoming more unsteady on his feet, and needing to sit and rest more often. This item works well. My only concern is the brakes don't totally brake the wheels, thus letting them slide along. My father hasn't pushed the rollator too hard, so it hasn't been a problem....yet.
customer_reviews.author: Susan L. Pollard

customer_reviews.title: Decided to try this product due to the excellent reviews and great price
customer_reviews.text: While waiting to see a rheumatologist for leg pain, I was trying to get by with a cane. Decided to try this product due to the excellent reviews and great price. It has been life-changing for me. So easy to get around now. So many well thought out construction details. Sturdy device. The seat is so handy for transporting drinks/refreshments. Little vinyl basket is very useful for transporting hobby supplies around the house. Love the way lifting the strap folds it right up. The brakes are a bit difficult to use, but everything else about it is top notch. Love this deep red color.
customer_reviews.author: Joe964

customer_reviews.title: Best walker ever.
customer_reviews.text: I love this walker. I have another one I have used for a year. This one is so much easier to use and much lighter. It is so much easier to fold up and put in my car. I was Leary that the wheels and back had to be put on. I am disabled and mechanically disinclined. I think it took all of ten minutes to put it together. My only regret is that I did not get it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: KITTYCAT

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful & most reasonably priced
customer_reviews.text: I've had and used rollators from at least three manufacturers. This one from Drive medical is my favorite. The attention ti detail is obvious from the moment it comes out of the box. Everything is complete except two handles and a short section of attached tubing assembly time <5 minutes. The backrest with cushioned surface folds out of the way making it easier to load for transport. The brake levers are of the feather touch type.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Horlick

customer_reviews.title: Great walker
customer_reviews.text: I like that it is light, easy to put in the car, easy to use and the color blur is very nice. What I don't like is that there is no strap to hold it folded. A simple Velcro strap would make it easier for transporting or putting it out of the way in a restaurant.
customer_reviews.author: Labor Law

customer_reviews.title: We like this walker, its lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Nice walker but i wish the handles went up higher. Good and lightweight, too. Fits in trunk. A little hard to unfold fast.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy L. Plamann

customer_reviews.title: Good stable piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: When my husband's arthritis had a sudden and debilitating flare up, we needed to get him a means to move about the house quickly. This rolling walker was easy to put together and helped him remain stable far more than the cane he was using. It also arrived a day early which is one less day that he was immobile.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Coe

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This was open box and got a discount for it. No damage on item. Works well. Like the under seat storage is a bag and not a metal basket.
customer_reviews.author: Ro Kellie

customer_reviews.title: ALUMINUM WALKER
customer_reviews.text: Iam very pleased. The walker is light weight, easy to handle. I am almost eighty and find it easy to put in the car by myself. It doesn,t mark carpet as bad as my other one and it is less noisy when rolling on concrete or pavement. I like the pocket under seat as it is much easier to carry my mail. It was easy to assemble. GREAT
customer_reviews.author: Cora

customer_reviews.title: Price is right
customer_reviews.text: Product greatly helps with my balance and gait...very easy to assemble as most of walker is pre-assembled and only requires attaching arms to proper position...only improvement it needs is some kind of feature to keep folded walker from opening up when putting in vehicle...l did what other reviews suggested and use a bungee cord to keep walker closed when taking it out of or into my car...would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Open Box Item Missing Part
customer_reviews.text: This "Open Box" walker was purported to be complete with all parts. It was not. A cable clamp was missing and the two threaded pins with knobs that clamp the handlebars were loose in the box. After reading the fine print, I could not get a part replacement part from Amazon, I would have to go to the manufacturer. Not possible since it was an "Open Box" item. That clamp, probably a 50 cent part, cost over $10 to order from a parts source. The walker is great, very light and sturdy. Amazon's return warehouse is the problem.
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this walker. Great product at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent walker. Bought it for a friend of mine and it's not only sharp looking its extremely functional. It folds up compactly but the best part is there is a seat in case the person gets tired they can rest for a little moment or 2. It also has great brakes which is a very important feature. It's lightweight yet quite sturdy. I highly recommend this item
customer_reviews.author: Dirk Winston

customer_reviews.title: Only for Short People
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good product and it was easy to assemble. But.... if you are over 5'5" - male or female, I am female.... the handle bars are too low. It is uncomfortable, particular if you have back issues. I've adjusted the handle bars as high as they will go. Were it not for this fact, I would have rated this 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: lzgram

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Very well built. Easy set up from shipping box. Smooth operation. I like the under seat storage. Brakes work really well.
customer_reviews.author: Debra A Webber

customer_reviews.title: Saving me from falls!
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and stable. Very well built. I was frequently falling with my cane even in the home, but now I can move fast and sure with my "Blue Streak Rollator".
customer_reviews.author: Steve Gladfelter

customer_reviews.title: My first rollator
customer_reviews.text: I love this walker for around my home. It’s a bit heavy for the car and on errands, but is very sturdy and maneuverable around the house and neighborhood. I have a lighter rollator for the car, but I’m very happy with this rollator.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Well made and very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, well made product. It came fully assembled with the brakes adjusted perfectly. I weigh about 160lbs and it can easily handle that. I'm going through some issues with my back and needed something to help me be more mobile. This is the "ticket" to that mobility. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Joper

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: Never thought I'd need help walking, but I'm very glad this rollator was available to me. So far it has worked like a dream. I am OCD when it comes to doing research and reading reviews, and, so far, I'm very happy with my decision.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Good solid walker
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my parents while they were visiting. They used it indoors as well as outdoors. They both have mobility limitations and love this walker for its ease of use, maneuverability, and solid construction. The brakes keep them stabilized while they lean down to pick things up or put on shoes. There are lots of options for light storage. It can be easily dismantled to fit back into the slim box for storage. The wheels are a good size so as to not wedge in sidewalk cracks/gaps but not so big that they are tripping hazards.
customer_reviews.author: HCYu

customer_reviews.title: Quick shipping for an emergency situation
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my mother who fell and hurt herself. Brakes work great, excellent product. Quick delivery
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product at an economical price!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item as a Prime Member on a Sunday night following my arthroscopic knee surgery. I was so impressed when it arrived on Tuesday. There was minimal assembly, it was lightweight and ready for use in minutes! I have used it all day and it has really given me such a sense of security from falls. I am very impressed at the very economical/competitive pricing for such a great item. This rollator will be useful for me in my future since I have had arthritis for many years. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Mimi W.

product_meta.title: Drive Medical Aluminum Rollator Walker Fold Up and Removable Back Support, Padded Seat, 6" Wheels, Red
product_meta.description: Color:RedThe Walker Rollator with 6" Wheels, Fold Up Removable Back Support and Padded Seat in Red by Drive Medical comes standard with 6" caster wheels, loop locks and serrated brakes to ensure safety. The seamless padded seat opens to a roomy, convenient, zippered storage pouch to easily and securely transport personal items, and the ergonomic handles are easy to grip, relieve hand pressure, and are height adjustable to accommodate users height. This Rollator by Drive Medical is a great value that provides the freedom of mobility. With a convenient seat for resting and loop locks that keep the Rollator from moving, you can be assured that this mobility aid will provide a safe and secure way to regain your active lifestyle.
feature_bullets: Comes with a seamless padded seat and a zippered pouch underneath the seat for added privacy and security of personal items
Removable, hinged, padded backrest can be folded up or down. Large 7.5 Inch casters are ideal for indoor and outdoor use
6" Black non marring casters with soft grip tires are ideal for indoor and outdoor use
Easy to use deluxe loop locks and Brakes with serrated edges provide a firm hold
Handle Height: 32 37"; Seat Dimensions: 12"(D) x 14"(W) x 20"(H); Weight Capacity: 300 lbs

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars4,081 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
